It's not as meaningful to get a compliment from someone who's always nice. In past seasons, you'd see people running out of the[ judging] room saying,` Simon Cowell loved me!' Simon Cowell was always the one people cared about, because he was the hardest one to get. Thompson points out that, as a British unknown looking for American fame, Simon Cowell used meanness as a savvy PR move- one that wouldn"t work for Jennifer Lopez or Steven Tyler . In an interview with ABC news on the eve of the book's release, Donald Rumsfeld said, What you know today can help you unthink your thinking about tomorrow. Donald Rumsfeld said, "It can't help you with things you were thinking about back then," and added, "Back then there was reasonable confidence that[ Saddam Hussein ] had these weapons."

, the singer may join Simon Cowell on the show when it begins filming later this year. "To get her on the show would give it real star power," a source told the magazine. Nicole Scherzinger and Cheryl Cole are also being considered for places on the judging panel, because they've got a proven track record of being great judges, but that doesn't rule Rihanna out.
